meanings.definition: To sponsor or support jointly with another person or group.
meanings.sent1: The two friends cosponsor the charity event together.
meanings.sent2: Many companies cosponsor the annual conference.
meanings.sent3: The siblings decided to cosponsor a lemonade stand in their backyard.
meanings.sent4: The two countries cosponsor a peace treaty to promote harmony.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors cosponsor a neighborhood watch program to enhance safety.

meanings.definition: A person or group that sponsors or supports something jointly with another.
meanings.sent1: She is one of the cosponsors of the school fundraiser.
meanings.sent2: The cosponsors of the event were acknowledged during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cosponsors of the bake sale wore matching aprons.
meanings.sent4: The cosponsors of the project shared the responsibilities equally.
meanings.sent5: The cosponsors of the art exhibition received recognition for their contribution.
